SEARCH
Package logic

Class Logic

java.lang.Object
logic.Logic
public class Logic extends Object
Handles the game logic for a Yahtzee game, including dice operations and score calculations.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Logic()
    Default constructor initializing with default players: "User" and "Computer".
    Logic(String[] players)
    Constructor initializing the game with a specified list of players.

  • Constructor Details

    • Logic

      public Logic()
      Default constructor initializing with default players: "User" and "Computer".

    • Logic

      public Logic(String[] players)
      Constructor initializing the game with a specified list of players.
      Parameters:
      players - Array of player names.

  • Method Details

    • getNumberOfPlayers

      public int getNumberOfPlayers()
      Returns the number of players in the game.
      Returns:
      Number of players.

    • getPlayerScore

      public int[] getPlayerScore(int i)
      Retrieves the score for all categories for a specific player.
      Parameters:
      i - Index of the player.
      Returns:
      Array of scores for the player.

    • calculateScore

      public int[] calculateScore(int playerIndex)
      Calculates the score for all categories for a specific player and updates the player's score.
      Parameters:
      playerIndex - Index of the player whose score is to be calculated.
      Returns:
      Array of calculated scores.

    • updateAutomaticValues

      public void updateAutomaticValues(int playerIndex)
      Updates automatic score values for a specific player based on their current scores. It adjusts values like total without bonus, bonus, final upper total, final lower total, and final total if they are not already set.
      Parameters:
      playerIndex - Index of the player whose scores are being updated.

    • throwDices

      public void throwDices()
      Throws the dice that are not marked as saved. Each die's value is updated only if it has not been saved by the player.

    • getDices

      public int[] getDices()
      Retrieves the current values of all dice.
      Returns:
      An array of integers representing the values of the five dice.

    • processDices

      public void processDices(int[] chosenDices, String option)
      Updates the save status of dice based on the chosen dice and the provided option.
      Parameters:
      chosenDices - Array of dice indices to update.
      option - String indicating whether to save or unsave the dice ("s" for save, other for unsave).

    • isDiceSaved

      public boolean isDiceSaved(int index)
      Checks if a specific die is saved based on its index.
      Parameters:
      index - Index of the die to check.
      Returns:
      True if the die is saved, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the index is out of range.

    • saveDice

      public void saveDice(int index)
      Marks a specific die as saved based on its index.
      Parameters:
      index - Index of the die to be marked as saved.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the index is out of range.

    • unsaveDice

      public void unsaveDice(int index)
      Marks a specific die as unsaved based on its index.
      Parameters:
      index - Index of the die to be marked as unsaved.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the index is out of range.

    • unsaveDices

      public void unsaveDices()
      Marks all dice as unsaved.

    • isGameOver

      public boolean isGameOver()
      Checks if the game is over by verifying if all players have filled all their fields.
      Returns:
      True if the game is over, false otherwise.

    • isPlayerDone

      public boolean isPlayerDone(int playerIndex)
      Checks if a specific player has finished their game by verifying if all their fields are filled.
      Parameters:
      playerIndex - Index of the player to check.
      Returns:
      True if the player is done, false otherwise.

    • getFieldNames

      public String[] getFieldNames()
      Retrieves the names of all fields in the score table.
      Returns:
      Array of field names.

    • getEmptyFields

      public int[] getEmptyFields(int playerIndex)
      Gets the indices of empty fields for a specific player.
      Parameters:
      playerIndex - Index of the player.
      Returns:
      Array of indices of empty fields.

    • saveField

      public void saveField(int playerIndex, int fieldIndex, int[] scores)
      Saves the score for a specific field and player.
      Parameters:
      playerIndex - Index of the player.
      fieldIndex - Index of the field to save the score in.
      scores - Array of scores to be saved.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the fieldIndex is out of range.

    • getWinner

      public String getWinner()
      Determines the winner(s) of the game based on the highest final score. If there are multiple players with the highest score, their names are all included.
      Returns:
      A string containing the names of the winner(s), separated by commas. Returns an empty string if no winners are found.

    • getPlayers

      public String[] getPlayers()
      Retrieves the names of all players participating in the game.
      Returns:
      An array of strings where each element is the name of a player.

    • getScores

      public int[][] getScores()
      Retrieves the scores for all players, organized by field.
      Returns:
      A 2D array where each row represents a player and each column represents a field score.

    • setScores

      public void setScores(int[][] scores)
      Updates the scores for all players based on the provided 2D array.
      Parameters:
      scores - A 2D array where each row contains the new scores for a player.

    • getBestIndex

      public int getBestIndex(int[] emptyFields, int[] scores)
      Determines the index of the best field to score based on the current empty fields and scores. The function excludes certain fields that cannot be changed and selects the field with the highest score.
      Parameters:
      emptyFields - An array indicating which fields are available for scoring.
      scores - An array containing scores for each field.
      Returns:
      The index of the field with the highest score among the available fields.
